*div1 type="summary"* *p*William S. Hall to Austin, April 27, 1826. Advice concerning Indian campaign*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Bolevar*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="04-27-1826">Ap1 27th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir I recd your communication and have duly attended to them: From the best information I cane obtain the *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned* perfectly coincide with you as respects the premeditated Campaign It is my desire that we should be as expeditious as possible and for this assertion I have two very essential reasons 1st. If we postpone it any length of time they may obtain information of our contemplated attack and consequently they will be prepared either for battle or flight 2d they will be ginelly in their *location_mentioned*villages */location_mentioned*about the time we cane get in readiness to march against them which will be about the middle of *date_mentioned n="05-15-1826">May */date_mentioned*I shall convene all those that voluntier in this *person_mentioned*company */person_mentioned*on the *date_mentioned n="05-12-1826">12th of May*/date_mentioned*. You can inform me at what time you wish me to arrive at *location_mentioned*San felipe Austin*/location_mentioned*, I shall be at [all] times ready to march after the *date_mentioned n="05-12-1826">12th of May*/date_mentioned* but it will be more convenient to march within a few days after I convene the *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*together as I shall give orders to them to come prepared for the expedition*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*W- S Hall*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col S F Austin*/person_mentioned* */p*
*/div1*
